availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Q. Mackey (Caldwell County, Kentucky, brick mason and stone mason)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, mason. Ohio native. Married to Adelisa M. Dunn Mackey in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on August 6, 1845. Father of Martha J. Mackey, Johnson Arabel Mackey Kilgore, Lizetta Mackey, Mary Mackey, Pernicia A. Mackey, and George P. Mackey. Married to Polly Kilgore Mackey in Caldwell County in February 1865. Brickmason in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Stone mason in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 500A.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994029, Caldwell County Marriages, p. 295.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 258.
